Key Match Events: Cubs took advantage of mistakes by the Dodgers, particularly in a five-run eighth inning to come back and win on Tuesday.
Cubs found themselves on the other side of things after mistakes proved costly on Wednesday, including a botched double-steal attempt in the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Craig Counsell emphasized the importance of the Cubs playing their best baseball of the season to keep their slim-yet-extant hopes for the postseason alive.
Post-Match Reflections: Cody Bellinger said 'You're never out of it until you're officially out of it' after the loss.
Manager Craig Counsell called the baserunning blunders 'inexcusable'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs tallied 24 runs in the series win in LA, with 10 of remaining 16 games at Wrigley.
The Cubs have averaged 5.11 runs per road game, compared to four runs per game at Wrigley Field this season.
Others: The Cubs have five series remaining this season, and four are against sub-.500 teams.
The Cubs play three this weekend at Coors Field against the Rockies (54-92), then come home for three against the Aâ€™s (64-82) and four against the Nationals (65-80).
